metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13288 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, the Parser::getObj() function in Parser.cc may cause infinite recursion via a crafted file. A remote attacker can leverage this for a DoS attack. This is similar to CVE-2018-16646.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-13288` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
libpoppler111 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
poppler-utils - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> doesn't seem to reproduce in poppler ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore.

criterions.comment: poppler package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu4').
xpdf package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
